info.headline: Avalanche Watch issued January 17 at 6:13AM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...The Forest Service Sawtooth Avalanche Center in Ketchum has ISSUED a BACKCOUNTRY AVALANCHE WATCH which is in effect from 6 AM MST Wednesday to 6 PM MST Wednesday... * WHAT...A brief but intense storm is forecast to impact our area during the day Wednesday and into Thursday. Very dangerous avalanche conditions are expected to develop overnight. Backcountry AVALANCHE WARNINGS may be issued. * WHERE...The Sawtooth, western Smoky, Soldier, and southern Salmon River Mountains, including the mountains surrounding Banner Summit, Stanley, Smiley Creek, Atlanta, and Fairfield. The backcountry avalanche watch does not apply to highway avalanche programs or operating ski areas. * WHEN...In effect from Wed 06:00 MST to Wed 18:00 MST. * IMPACTS...Large, natural and human-triggered avalanches will become very likely as heavy snowfall and strong wind overload a weak, unstable snowpack. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...As conditions worsen, travel in avalanche terrain should be avoided. Stay off of and out from below steep slopes—slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. Avalanches may be triggered remotely—from flat terrain above, below, and to the sides of steep slopes. Natural and human- triggered avalanches may run long distances and can impact gentler terrain below. Consult www.sawtoothavalanche.com or www.avalanche.org for more detailed information. Similar avalanche danger may exist at locations outside the coverage area of this or any avalanche center.
